me.tatarka.ipromise

Class Deferred<T,E extends java.lang.Exception>

  • java.lang.Object
    • me.tatarka.ipromise.Deferred<T,E>
  • Type Parameters:
    T - the type of a successful result
    E - the type of an error result

    public class Deferred<T,E extends java.lang.Exception>
extends java.lang.Object
    A Deferred is the producer end of a Promise. An asynchronous method creates a Deferred and returns promise(), then calls resolve(Object) or reject(Exception) at a later time. 
    {@code
    public Promise async() {
       final Deferred deferred = new Deferred();
       doAsync(new Callback() {

    • Method Detail

      • promise

        public Promise<T,E> promise()

      • resolve

        public void resolve(T success)
        Delivers a successful result to all listeners of the Promise. Only one result can be delivered. If the promise has already been canceled, the result will not be stored and listeners will not be notified.
        Parameters:
        success - the successful result to reject.
        Throws:
        Promise.AlreadyDeliveredException - throws if a result has already been delivered.

      • reject

        public void reject(E error)
        Delivers an error result to all listeners of the Promise. Only one result can be delivered. If the promise has already been canceled, the result will not be stored and listeners will not be notified.
        Parameters:
        error - the error result to reject.
        Throws:
        Promise.AlreadyDeliveredException - throws if a result has already been delivered.
